Jongleur.background_description: What inspires the soul more than song, words, and spectacle? Why practice for years to master the arcane when you've already got real magic inside?

table1.question: What happened at your final performance?

options.description: Despite your training in the deadly arts, an actor died and you were blamed. Take a light-weight Rapier (d6) and a false identity.
The crowd loved your catchy tune about a noble and his romantic failings. The noble in question, not so much. Take the Read Mind Spellbook and a warrant for your arrest.

items.name: Read Mind Spellbook
items.description: You can hear the surface thoughts of nearby creatures. Long-term possession can cause the reader to mistake the thoughts of others as their own.

options.description: Your debut composition reduced the audience to a gibbering mess, murmuring of bright creatures descending from the night sky. Later you noticed that the notes resembled stellar constellations. Take a Book On Astronomy and a lot of questions.

You mocked a forgotten trickster god and were cursed for it. You speak only in perfect rhyme. Ironically, this has only made you more popular among your peers. Take a Thesaurus (20gp). Without it, you are deprived.

items.name: Thesaurus
items.description: Worth 20gp. Without it you are deprived.

options.description: You were scarred in an on-stage accident. The crowd cheered, thinking it was part of the act. Take well-worn Stage Mail (1 Armor), a memorable scar, and a fear of applause.

Your respectable puppeteering skills were matched only by your mimicry. You were so good you were branded a witch (literally) and banished. Take an Uncanny Hand-Puppet and a Rabbit Skull (petty) that protects against charms.

table2.question: What trinket were you unable to leave behind?

options.description: False Cuffs: Comfortable, realistic-looking cuffs. Only you know the trick to get out of them.

items.name: False Cuffs
items.description: Comfortable, realistic-looking cuffs. Only you know the trick to get out of them.

options.description: Pocket Theatre: A set of small puppets and a folding stage. Good for quick distractions.

items.name: Pocket Theatre
items.description: A set of small puppets and a folding stage. Good for quick distractions.

options.description: Ghost Violin: A dark-grey violin that plays a haunting tune, mirrored by an invisible, distant twin.

items.name: Ghost Violin
items.description: A dark-grey violin that plays a haunting tune, mirrored by an invisible, distant twin.

options.description: Tragic Tales: Banned in proper company, this book becomes less bawdy and more harrowing towards the end. Worth 100gp.

items.name: Tragic Tales
items.description: Banned in proper company, it becomes less bawdy and more harrowing towards the ends. Worth 100gp.

options.description: Mythos Mask: A plaster mask that allows one to take on a monster's countenance. Once it comes off, add a Fatigue.

items.name: Mythos Mask
items.description: A plaster mask that allows one to take on a monster's countenance. Once it comes off, add a Fatigue.

options.description: Rebreak Glass: A wine flute that can be broken multiple times, reforming after 24 hours. Makes a really loud noise.

items.name: Rebreak Glass
items.description: A wine flute that can be broken multiple times, reforming after 24 hours. Makes a really loud noise.
